content:
The chunk of code in question is part of a larger Python script that appears to handle Maya file conversions and integrate the results into an animation system. The specific chunk occurs at the end of the `onProcessEnded` method, which is called after a conversion process has completed. This method processes the results of the conversion, handles model and animation files, updates object properties, and triggers a callback with the final results.

The code in the chunk checks if the processed file is an animation or a model and prepares the appropriate output names (e.g., `modelName`, `animName`) for further use. It also interacts with some kind of object definition (`objDef`) and node path (`objNP`) to manage animations, potentially updating properties and triggering UI updates in an editor interface.

In summary, this chunk is part of a Maya-to-egg conversion workflow that handles post-conversion tasks, including animation integration, model file management, and property updates for an interactive object editor.

name = os.path.basename(self.mayaFile)
        if self.isAnim:
            if self.obj:
                objDef = self.obj[OG.OBJ_DEF]
                objNP = self.obj[OG.OBJ_NP]
                animName = "%s.anim.egg"%self.mayaFile
                if animName not in objDef.anims:
                    objDef.anims.append(animName)
                name = os.path.basename(animName)
                objNP.loadAnims({name:animName})
                objNP.loop(name)
                self.obj[OG.OBJ_ANIM] = animName
                self.editor.ui.objectPropertyUI.updateProps(self.obj)
                return
            else:
                modelName = "%s.model.egg"%self.mayaFile
                animName = "%s.anim.egg"%self.mayaFile
                result = [name, modelName, animName]
        else:
            modelName = "%s.egg"%self.mayaFile
            result = [name, modelName]

        if self.callBack:
            self.callBack(result)
